snippet: The players argue that plans to play next summer’s Women’s World Cup in Canada on artificial turf amount to sex discrimination under Ontario law.
abstract: Group of the world’s best female soccer players sue FIFA and the Canadian Soccer Association, arguing that plan to play next summer’s Women’s World Cup in Canada on artificial turf amounts to gender discrimination under Canadian law; filing seeks an order requiring that the tournament be played on natural grass fields, and also proposes possible resolutions.
lead_paragraph: The players argue that plans to play next summer’s Women’s World Cup in Canada on artificial turf amount to sex discrimination under Ontario law.

headline.main: Stars Sue Organizers of Women’s World Cup Over Use of Turf
headline.print_headline: Stars Sue Organizers of Women’s World Cup Over Use of Turf
